definition: Soong Mei-ling (1898-2003), Chiang Kai-shek's second wife
surname Song/the Song dynasty (960-1279)/also Song of the Southern dynasties 南朝宋 (420-479)
the Americas/abbr. for 美洲[Mei3 zhou1]/USA/abbr. for 美國|美国[Mei3 guo2]
beautiful/very satisfactory/good/to beautify/to be pleased with oneself
age/length of experience, membership etc

sentences.english: Did you know which famous star that was forced out by Songmeiling in those years?
sentences.chinese: 知道谁是当年被宋美龄封杀的好莱坞中国女星吗？

sentences.english: Almost at the same time, Madame Chiang threw in her lot with the generalissimo.
sentences.chinese: 差不多也就在这个时候，宋美龄嫁给了蒋介石。

sentences.english: Stilwell thought the influence of Madame on her husband was along the right lines.
sentences.chinese: 史迪威认为宋美龄对蒋介石的影响有良好的一面。

sentences.english: Songmeiling thought that she represented the figure of old Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 宋美龄认为她代表的是旧中国人的形象。

sentences.english: Who acts Song Meiling this time?
Madame Chiang Kai-shek was a diplomat par excellence. But she was not familiar with Japanese history.
sentences.chinese: 蒋宋美龄是位杰出的外交家，只是对日本史不够熟谙。

sentences.english: If I'm correct, this is her second time acting Song Meiling.
sentences.chinese: 如果我没记错，这是她第二次扮演宋美龄了。

definition: Song Qingling or Rosemonde Soong (1893-1981), wife of Sun Yat-sen 孫中山|孙中山[Sun1 Zhong1 shan1]
Zhang Xueliang (1901-2001) son of Fengtian clique warlord, then senior general for the Nationalists and subsequently for the People's Liberation Army
Chiang Kai-shek (1887-1975), military leader, head of the Nationalist government in China 1928-1949 and the government in exile on Taiwan 1950-1975
Li Zongren (1891-1969), a leader of Guangxi warlord faction
Chiang Ching-kuo (1910-1988), son of Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石, Guomindang politician, president of ROC 1978-1988
Chiang Wei-kuo (1916-1997), adopted son of Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石
Deng Yingchao (1904-1992), Chinese communist leader, wife of Zhou Enlai 周恩來|周恩来
Chen Xiangmei (1925-2018), a.k.a. Anna Chennault, born in Beijing, US Republican Party politician, wife of Claire Lee Chennault 陳納德|陈纳德[Chen2 na4 de2]
Zhou Enlai (1898-1976), Chinese communist leader, prime minister 1949-1976
Du Yuesheng (1888-1951), Shanghai secret-society leader, banker, industrialist
Zhang Zhizhong (1890-1969), National Revolutionary Army general
He Yingqin (1890-1987), senior Guomindang general
Wang Ching-wei (1883-1944), left-wing Guomingdang politician, subsequently Japanese collaborator
John Leighton Stuart (1876-1962), second-generation American missionary in China, first president of Yenching University and later United States ambassador to China
Hu Shi (1891-1962), original proponent of writing in colloquial Chinese 白話文|白话文[bai2 hua4 wen2]
Premier Zhou Enlai 周恩來|周恩来 (1898-1976)
